frontText: A(n) ____ is used for intellectual property protection of an invention.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.230
frontText: What are five examples of confidentiality concerns?
backText: Snooping, eavesdropping, wiretapping, social engineering, and dumpster diving

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.231
frontText: What are four examples of integrity concerns?
backText: Man‐in‐the‐middle, replay attack, impersonation, unauthorized information alteration

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.232
frontText: What are five examples of availability concerns?
backText: Denial of service, power outage, hardware failure, destruction, service outage

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.233
frontText: In information security, a(n) _____ concern is one that involves maintaining privacy of data.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.234
frontText: In information security, a(n) _____ concern is one that involves ensuring the data is true and accurate.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.235
frontText: In information security, a(n) _____ concern is one that involves ensuring the data is accessible when users need it.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.236
frontText: Requiring another form of identification in addition to a password in order to log in is known as what?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.237
frontText: List examples of authentication factors.
backText: Password, PIN, one‐time password, software token, hardware token, biometrics, specific location, security questions

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.238
frontText: When a user types a password once and is given access to multiple systems, what is that called?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.239
frontText: What security concept asks the question, “Who are you?”

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.240
frontText: What security concept determines what you can do on a network?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.241
frontText: When assigning security permissions, always follow the _____ ______ model.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.242
frontText: When users are allowed to assign their own permissions, that is known as a ______ access control model.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.243
frontText: When users are assigned permissions based on job function and can’t be assigned permissions based on their user account, that is known as a ______ access control model.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.244
frontText: Which access control model uses security labels, classifications, and categories?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.245
frontText: Which security concept is responsible for tracking user actions on a system?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.246
frontText: Which security concept ensures that users can’t deny that an event took place?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.247
frontText: Two ways to track user actions on a system are what?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.248
frontText: What are four examples of nonrepudiation factors?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.249
frontText: To harden a device, you can disable communications features such as ____ and ____.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.250
frontText: The key combination of _______ lets a user lock their computer when they leave.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.251
frontText: _____ is the process of scrambling the data in user files so that others cannot read them.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.252
frontText: To protect a computer against viruses and spyware, install _______.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.253
frontText: The three types of accounts on a computer are what?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.254
frontText: The _____ user account should be disabled for security purposes unless it is being used.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.255
frontText: Passwords should not be ____ among different websites.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.256
frontText: Many companies will have passwords _____ periodically as part of a security policy.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.257
frontText: The process of providing proper credentials to access a computer resource is called ______.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.258
frontText: Needing to provide a password and present a smart card to log in is an example of _____ ______.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.259
frontText: The three types of information used in multifactor authentication are what?
backText: Something you know, something you have, something you are

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.260
frontText: The ability to enter login information once and have it transfer to other systems is called what?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.261
frontText: Risks of using public workstations include what three things?
backText: Shoulder surfing, keyloggers (or other malware), unsecured wireless networks

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.262
frontText: _____ Wi‐Fi networks are unsecure and should not be used.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.263
frontText: What should be true about a web browser’s version before you use it?
backText: It should be the most current version.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.264
frontText: What is the name of the feature that completes your name and address for you in web pages?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.265
frontText: What is the name of a file a website downloads to your computer to identify you?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.266
frontText: What are two ways to identify a secure website?
backText: Starts with HTTPS:// and has a lock symbol in the address bar

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.267
frontText: What are three symptoms of adware?
backText: Constant pop‐ups, home page (or browser) redirection, search engine redirection

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.268
frontText: To protect your security, you should limit the use of ______ on the Internet.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.269
frontText: What should you not do if you receive a hyperlink or attachment in a suspicious email?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.270
frontText: The first place to check when you have a device failure or question is where?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.271
frontText: Which three external issues should you check for when troubleshooting a computer?
backText: Loose cables or connectors, power, and physical damage

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.272
frontText: In addition to manufacturer documentation and websites, what are two external resources to check for technical help?
backText: Technical community groups, Internet search, and technical support

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.273
frontText: To preserve your data in the case of hardware failure, you should _______ your data.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.274
frontText: To make sure you run consistent software backups, be sure to ______ them.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.275
frontText: If you have important data that changes often, you should run backups more _______.

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.276
frontText: What are three options for backup storage locations?
backText: Locally attached storage, network‐attached storage, off‐site/cloud

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.277
frontText: Which backup storage location option is the fastest? Local, network, or cloud?

title: fc513124.ITFunSG2E.278
frontText: After backing up data, what is the first thing you should do?
backText: Test and verify that the backup works.
